CatDescriptText: Gertrude Lipscomb, 2311 Milligan Avenue, East Pittsburgh, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, August 23, 1958, pg. A1 with question: "In the coming November elections, do you think voters should elect another Democratic Governor or change to a Republican?" answer reads: "They should change to the Republicans. Although times are tight, I'm still a Republican.  The main reason I think that there should be a change is because the Republicans will better the conditions."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Gertrude Lipscomb wearing dress with large button, brooch, wristwatch, and carrying large handbag, standing on sidewalk of Fifth Avenue, Oakland
